subject: Programming
title: Compilers and Interpreters
description: A micro-lesson that makes Compilers and Interpreters usable.

hook.text: Code written in Python looks nothing like the binary a CPU executes. Something must translate.

buildup.text: A compiler translates the entire program to machine code before it runs. C and Rust use compilers.

discovery.text: An interpreter translates one line at a time while the program runs. Python and JavaScript do this.

twist.text: Compiled code runs faster. Interpreted code is easier to debug. Neither approach is strictly better.

climax.text: Modern languages blur the line. Java compiles to bytecode, then a JIT compiler optimizes at runtime.

punchline.text: Human-readable code always needs a translator.

quiz.question: What does a compiler do?
options: Translates entire programs to machine code before running
Runs code one line at a time
